result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald Harland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resist/Obstruct - County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 9/1/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 7 days jail, consecutive, for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald Harland

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donald Harland in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Shawn Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Woller advises the Court there has been an attempt to contact the victim in the case.   The State moves to amend Count #3 to a county ordinance of resisting and obstructing.  The Court amends the charge accordingly, enter a no contest plea and finds the Defendant guilty.  Counts #1 and #2 are dismissed and read into Count #3.  The Defendant was sentenced as follows:
FINE: $330.50 to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing 9/1/16 or serve 7 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 7/13/16 and 7/19/16.
Jury status hearing on July 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 19, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Donald Harland in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Shawn Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties have reached a resolution.  The State motions the Court to amend count #2 to a non criminal obstruction citation and the remaining counts would be dismissed outright. The Court does not accept the motion and the Court adjourns the trial and reschedules the trial.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Filed by Atty Weitzner.
